content: Ugh, just not good. The app starts slowly, crashes repeatedly, changes settings at random, can't hold a frame-rate (frame-rate can vary up to 15 percent above or below what it's set to), yields markedly noisier video than the phone's camera alone. The UI is clunky and poorly thought out. For example: Under "Framerate", you have to make sure "Timelapse" is highlighted to set the frame-rate options, and "Framerate" is highlighted to set the time lapse options. Now I understand why the developers have consistently ignored requests for a free "lite" version: if people saw what this app does (or, more accurately, what it can't do) nobody would buy it. My refund request was denied, so I guess they get my money and I get two hours of frustration before uninstalling the broken POS. DO NOT BUY THIS APP!

content: Everything works apart from when I use an external microphone. Filmic pro will sometimes recognize it and sometimes it won't. Very frustrating and not worth the money. Using the app on OnePlus 8 pro which is a flagship android phone. Revisions to the post for clarity; - I am using the Rode Video mic micro - The stock camera app on the Oneplus pro 8 will not support any external mic - Filmic pro will recognize the fact I am using an external mic but the audio I get from it will often not be picked up. For instance, it will pick up when I tap the microphone but not when I speak into it or I will be very quite. - The audio gain has been turned up to max each time - However sometimes it will pic up all of the audio, in 10% of instances it will record the audio from the microphone well but with no consistency. I do not know why 1 in 10 times it will pick up the audio and in the others it is low or non-existent. Yes I am using the correct adapter. I have bought the SC7 cable and a USB-C converter for my phone. The usb C converter works as I have tested it with some headphones.
replyContent: Hi Rishi, thank you for the detailed info, it helps us to narrow down the issue. I'm sharing this with the rest of the team so we can take a look at it and, hopefully, fix it. Thank you again for your review and have a nice day!

content: I just wanted to provide an update to what I wrote a month ago (below), as I've been using Filmic Pro quite a bit in that time and have a much better handle on how it performs. I've increased my rating to a four, as once you get used to it, it's really a very good app. I normally use a BMPCC4K and edit in DaVinci Resolve and have used results from my phone in Resolve and I'm quite pleased as to how I can integrate video from my phone with video from my BMPCC4K. Despite the significant differences between the two cameras, the results can blend in well. I'm still hoping that Filmic Pro can update the app to allow shutter angle as a default setting with all fps choices. Give me that and it's a five star app. I just bought both the Filmic Pro and the Cinematographer Kit for my Xiaomi Redmi Note 9s and both work perfectly. A quick test with the Evaluator app indicated that all would be good and so it was. The only thing I can't work out is how to get the focus circle and exposure square both to appear in the centre of the screen on start up and the exposure square to be a bit larger. Additionally, I'm not sure whether the app sets the shutter angle automatically to 180 degrees, for when I open the manual control, the shutter speed is never twice the fps, but usually much lower. After a couple of days use, there are two issues that disappoint greatly. Firstly, the fact that you can't set a shutter angle and have it default to 180 degrees of the fps set is a huge omission. Secondly, whenever you set shutter speed/ISO, and return to the main screen, the settings revert to what it was before adjusting or you can't refocus/re-expose. Two major shortfalls for a pro app. I wanted to provide an update on this app. Firstly, other than the issues I noted, this app really does make the phone video work so much better. Editing in DaVinci Resolve produces excellent results and would be outstanding if the camera in the phone was one of the higher end ones. I've also been in contact with Filmic Pro and explained my issues, hopefully more clearly. If they can implement what I've suggested, then this app will offer features similar to a cinema camera.
replyContent: Hi, thank you for the detailed review. We've taken note of your request and it will be considered. However, you should know that we can't do that on Auto Exposure because that's handled by the manufacturer's implementation üòÖ. We could only do that for manual exposure. Thank you for your review and have a nice day!

This was changed a few years back as soon as we detected the issue, so it's not the last update üòÖ. Please reach us via androidsupport@filmicpro.com for further details. Thank you for your review and have a nice day!

content: This app is a purchase within a purchase. I thought I was buying the full version once and for all, only to realise I now I have to get the cinematographer's kit. Maybe I just read it wrong but I thought if this was free then added features would be for purchase. But instead, you buy it ....then have to buy it again. Why is the whole thing not sold at once. This is just so annoying. That's my biggest disappointment.
replyContent: Hi softavalanche, R&D of the Cinematographer Kit took years and most of our users don't need such advanced features, that's why it's an additional purchase - as stated on the app's description üòÖ. Thank you for your review and have a nice day!

content: Autofocus is not working... I've tried countless times to close and reopen the app but the problem persists...
replyContent: Hi Pavlos, most Android devices don't support continuous auto focus on reticle mode, but they do on center weighted mode (big rectangle). Could you check on such mode? Also, high speed fps (120 and above), may not support autofocus properly (the API is linked to the exposure). Thank you for your review and have a nice day!

content: I've had the software now for almost 2 years. Love the improvement in usability and features. However after the last couple of updates it just will not record sound. Tried the latest update and still nothing. Verified that it wasn't my equipment with 2 other pieces of software no issues at all with them.
replyContent: Hi Grant, could you check if your audio input gain is set to 100%, video only mode (Settings-Audio) is disabled and that the capture fps are the same as the playback fps? Also, could you reset the presets and try again? If the issue persists, please reach us via androidsupport@filmicpro.com. Thank you for your review and have a nice day!

content: Absolute rubbish and completely overrated. Yes it has some good features and it plays nice with a smooth 4 but that is about it. I downloaded the app that checks to see if your phone can run the app and what features will work. I told me my two android devices both less than six months old would work fine and that I would have all the resolutionsavailable that the phone had to offer, but no that IS NOT!!! the case. On both of my phones I cannot get 48 50 or 60fps at 4k or 1080 also at 1080p 120 and 240fps I just get a black screen or the software locks up. And then if you get past all that and actually record something the damn software hides your files. I selected the save to sd card option but there is no way of seeing where it has put them. I have searched the Sd card with Android file transfer and still cannot find them. They are there because when the card is removed FP reports them missing until I re insert the card where it reports it has found lost files and is restoring them, and there they are available. I am now trying to copy them to my sd using share file within filmic Pro but even that is rubbish. You point to the destination and hit share and Nothing!!! Is it copying?? There is no way to tell. I am approaching the company for a refund as this is not cheap software and to produ E something this shoddy is inexcusable
replyContent: Hi, the evaluator checks the max fps, not all of themüòÖ. Sadly, the lack of FPS is due to the manufacturer locking them, not us.The file is stored on the private app's folder when recording to SD card because the advanced recorder API demands such thingüòÖ. Clicking on the SD Card icon on the library will show the path.Thank you and have a nice day!

content: Rating 2 star because I downloaded for use with my gimbal by DJI Osmo Mobile 3. While most of the features are worth it, the coding does not enable use of the DJI gimbal's hardware and is a serious invonvenience. Specifically the record and zoom functionality

content: Used to work on my Huawei p20pro. For some reason, no matter the settings, my films are jittery, like skipping frames compared to native camera app were panning is smooth with nice flow. I paid for nothing.
replyContent: Hi Geo, I'm sorry you're suffering this üòå. Could you reset presets (Settings, Presets, reset to default) and try again? If the issue persists, don't hesitate and reach us via androidsupport@filmicpro.com, our support team will be happy to assist you. Thank you for your review and have a nice day!

content: Why log mode is not working in 4K resolution. And 60fps not working in 1080p. My device is Galaxy S20 Plus exynos 990 version. Please fix it.
replyContent: Hi Rabindra, sadly, the S20 has a driver issue (compressing the dynamic range) when color profiles are used at higher resolutions üòå. Regarding 1080p@60fps, for some reason has been blocked by Samsung, so we can't access it. Hopefully Samsung addresses theses issues via an OS upgrade. Thank you for your review and have a nice day!

content: Far from Pro...maybe gimmicky pro. Can't give this more than 2 stars after shooting for 14 hours only to find out that the software couldn't hold a consistent shooting frame rate. Despite setting it for 24fps the recorded files were all over the map...24...30...30.01. I had high expections but this app is painfully buggy that it is not even worth trying. I will be asking for my money back.
replyContent: Hi Mark, variable frame rate is inherent to mobile filmmaking. That being said, it shouldn't be THAT variable, meaning that it should stick close to 24fps, not 30 by any means. I'm sharing this with the rest of the team so we can dig deeper. Could you provide furhter info about the resolution@fps? Also, if you were using manual exposure? Thank you!

content: Shutter speed constantly resets back to something else. When you change another setting, when you change orientation, anything. It's not possible to set and lock a shutter speed, making this app unusable for the kind of people who would want it in the first place i.e. who want shutter speed control
replyContent: Hi Ro, we know this is happening on some devices, specially when recording at higher frame rates (120/240). We've been fixing many of the scenarios this was happening. By any chance, is this still happening on latest version (6.10.3)? Which resolution@fps configurations? Thank you for your review and have a nice day!

content: Worthless and useless app on p30 pro, used and wasted momey

Huawei is aware of them, so we hope they will be fixed via an OS upgrade. Thank you for your review and have a nice day!

content: For you as nice app to use but there is not so much to control on it for example osmo Mobil 3 is not available there and the frame it's up to 30 not more and that's not what I need .. my phone is xiaomi redmi note 8 pro and it hase good quality of camera so Why there is such defense btween ios and Android ?? content: App is great but wondering when we will be able to use the log colour profile at higher frame rates than 24,25 and 30fps?

content: Very good app that gives fine control over video recording. Only 4 stars however due to three points I hope they will be considered in the future: 1. content: Very good... very close to using a real manual camera. Great control. Changed my opinion on using my phone for video creation. So convenient compared to lugging around dslr rig. content: Definitely a great tool that brings my Moto G6+ video to life. Very workable footage for post editing in premier or da Vinci for even better results. So it's half an app. I wish there was a way to connect this app with my mirrorless camera. But presumably they would need to work with multiple firmwares to enable that.

On the other hand, we'd love to be able to control mirrorless cameras, but it's too hard at this moment. Thank you for your review and have a nice day!

content: I've been very disappointed in the Android version of this app: Changing the aperture breaks your frame rate (setting to 25fps is broken, reverting to a variable 30fps) and recordings are limited to 16mins each. content: I bought Filmic Pro (and its competitor, Cinema-FV5) to see if mobile phones are up to standard of my dedicated log footage cameras; a BlackMagic and an A6300. Both apps were very crash happy. F-Pro had another big issue that FV5 didn‚Äôt; frame drops. The fix is turning on airplane mode, closing other apps, plus running in gaming mode (performance mode on some phones). My phone isn‚Äôt high end (OnePlus 3) but that was enough to get past the dropped frames as long as I dont go above 2k. Camera FV5 can go up to 4k though, so there are performance issues with F-Pro that FV5 does not have (I tested this extensively using like-for-like footage). The remaining issue is the inability to reliably shoot flat or log footage; an overheating issue. Perhaps this will get better with future releases. Finally, worth noting a big feature that Filmic Pro has that Cinema-FV5 doesn‚Äôt have; the ability to set a 180 degree shutter (so 1/50s for 24fps). You need this for footage that has the smoothness of cinema rather than the overly sharp and jerky video look. This is a game changer, and even though F-Pro limits me to 2k. You also need a variable ND filter to get decent exposure. I recommend a 37mm variable ND on a 37mm threaded clip. In the end, F-Pro is the one to go for because it has a crucial feature that the competition doesn‚Äôt (180 degree shutter). It also works well on my aging onePlus 3 (as long as I accept 2k as the max resolution), and has the better UI.
replyContent: Hi Sham, thank you so much for your extended review üôÇ. I'm limited to 350c, so I just can tell you that other apps use the standard recorder (better performance) but we need to use the advanced one in order to support as many features as we do. Again, thank you and have a nice day!

content: Edited my review from 3 to 5 stars because my main issue is much more of Samsung's fault (locked camera api) than these guys, who give phenomenal support on forums. content: good customer support. grear app!

Huawei P20 Pro: 1. The Exposure Reticle adjustment circle does not work. Support reports that this is a Huawei problem, not an application. 2. You can not select one of the built-in cameras (in P20 Pro there are 3 of them), as is done for the iPhone. You can use only the main camera for shooting, and the telephoto cannot be used, respectively, the entire increase is digital, noisy and not sharp without any detail. Support reports that this problem is again related to Huawei ("Huawei doesn‚Äôt allow access via Camera2 API for 3rd party apps"), but another application, FREE and open source, Open Camera can use telephoto. You just need to make an increase of more than 3x and everything works. You can not do it yourself - see how it is done with Open Camera! 3. The problem is directly related to the second. Optical image stabilization is available only in the telesphoto camera and since it cannot be used in any way in shooting, there is also no stabilization. In a free application Open Camera, when you increase more than 3x, the video is automatically switched to the telephoto cam (specifically checked by closing the camera with your finger), and the optical stabilization is turned on.
replyContent: Hi Passiliy, all of these will be available after a major update we've been working for months (except the exposure reticle, because it's a driver issue). I'm sorry for the confusion because I didn't update the support team with this info and 99% of the time is because the manufacturer doesn't allow access, but not on your device. Thank you :)

content: I want to love this app - it has tons of useful features, from LOG to gimbal integration and anamorphic lens compatibility. On my old phone (Verizon LG G5) it had issues crashing, which thankfully seem gone with my current device (Pixel 3 XL). But the main thing currently keeping me from rating this as 4 or even maybe 5 stars is that I can't set the mic default to my external (Rode VideoMicro).  Every time I plug in the mic. Every time I exit and re-enter the app. Every time I even just unlock the phone, it defaults back to the built-in mic. It's incredibly inconvenient and annoying, especially as a daily vlogger that has to do this dozens of times a day, it becomes very repetitive and wasteful of my time - I've even missed several moments because I was too busy trying to fumble through my audio settings.  It's such a shame to me that such a seemingly simple fix is giving me so much frustration at an otherwise amazing app.
replyContent: Hi Ben, I'm sorry you're suffering this, we've been working on a workaround for this issue. Hopefully, it will be available sooner than later. Thank you for your review and have a nice day!

content: For what it does, this app is well worth the money. I was already very pleased with the stock videography features of my S7 but certain things were lacking (i.e. 24 fps option). Filmic has exceeded my expectations and delivers functionality I didn't even know I was missing such as auto focus pull. Start with the free evaluator to make sure the features you want will be available before you spend the money. Then, after you buy the app, spend the extra money to get the picture control pack. I know many people have complained that those features should be included in the app price but let's be real - for about $30, my phone is now a strong second camera for video shoots with some features even my DSLR doesn't have. That's money well spent in my book.
Had a little issue with external mic recording but they helped me fixed it. Thanks

content: For people who bought OSMO 2 after filmic: Clean Install FiLMiC Pro -Backup clips and make note of any presets that could potentially be lost -Go to System Settings>Apps>FiLMiC Pro>Storage>Clear Data -Uninstall FiLMiC Pro -Restart device or update OS if an update is available -Go back to the Play Store and download/install FiLMiC Pro again ....Then... -Go to System Settings on your Android device and disable bluetooth altogether -While in System Settings, make sure your device is connected to an active WIFI network -Open FiLMiC Pro and accept all permissions -Power on your Osmo Mobile 2 -Go to FiLMiC Settings>Hardware and enable DJI OSMO Mobile -When prompted, enable bluetooth on your device -Enable the DJI OSMO Mobile tab again, if necessary
replyContent: Thanks very much for your review and advice for OSMO 2 users. If you have any questions or feedback don't hesitate to drop us a line at androidsupport@filmicpro.com

content:
tl;dr: sad and disappointed. I have an s9 plus exynos. Was expecting the 
recording to be buttery smooth but was jittery. I tried all resolution with 
all framerates but just left disappointed. Maybe Im spoiled by the native 
camera app of samsung. This was after contacting support and we checked if 
it was writing to my sdcard, it was writing in the internal drive. I bought 
this to be able to control everything. I set my fps to 24fps and lock 
shutter speed to 1/48 (180 degree shutter rule) but after recording the 
value keeps changing. They have so many good features but I still keep 
using the native camera app to get smooth footage. The app also 
occasionally just become black and stuck there when switching resolution or 
relocking the shutter speed so I have to kill and open the app again. Not a 
good workflow when Im shooting something that is the spur of the moment. 
Waiting for the update that improves the performance. Im a developer so I 
know it's not the app's fault that samsung locked their camera sdk. Ill end 
my rant here.
replyContent: Hi Nino, you probably know this because you're a developer, but try to record disabling any app that may be running in the background. Also, enable airplane mode when possible. Regarding the other bugs, we will look into them and work on the fixes. Thank you for your extended review and have a nice day!

I saw this from the moment guys and purchased both the standard app, then

days with it and would like to see if I could get a refund on my ~$25.

Please atleast add button to take photo....also add function to vivid,

You have to buy additional app for ¬£7.99 to activate log future... What did

content:
WARNING if you have a Galaxy S9 and plan to pair Filmec Pro with the Osmo 
Mobile 2, you will be massively let down. They do not play nicely. Filmec 
Pro will connect with the Osmo about 20% of the time leaving you with less 
creative shooting and more creative swearing. Also 1080 120 FR slow motion 
does not work. It freezes and the screen goes dark. Things to think about. 
I went through all the steps with their support to no resolve. App has a 
ton of great features but the bugs leave a lot to be desired. When. you pay 
$25 for an app, you expect it to work properly.
replyContent: Hi Jared, due to a bug on the DJI SDK, our app must be completely closed before connecting to the OSMO Mobile. About 120fps, Samsung didn't implement properly this feature on the Snapdragon model, hopefully it can be fixed via an OS upgrade. Thank you for your review and have a nice day!

stabelization in the stock camera. I've even tried free camera apps that 
still have stabelization as a feature. I'm not sure why their is a reason 
this one app, (that I payed $25 for ) cannot implement some form of 
stabelization. Aside from that, the app has good reliability, and has been 
performing great! Good job Filmicüëè
replyContent: Hi Ethan, Google didn't implement the EIS properly for the camera2 API (other 3rd party apps use Camera1 API). We've been talking to Google about this so, hopefully, it can be fixed via an OS upgrade. Thank you for your review and have a nice day!

content:
Good app, works well with Osmo Mobile 2. Not sure if this is up to FiLMiC, 
but it would be fantastic if it supported Active Tracking too. I'm 
experiencing some problems on LG V30, maybe the app could get a little 
polishing for this device too considering it's very capable for video 
production. Some of the issues: -I can turn off noise reduction, it 
sometimes works but it turns itself back on whenever the preview 
reinitializes after changing other settings like resolution or after 
finishing recording a video. After this occurs, the only consistent way to 
turn the noise reduction back off is by going into settings, switching the 
noise reduction from disabled to fast or high then turning noise reduction 
off again, exiting settings, then move the focus reticle. -The audio 
channels are reversed on the V30 when the phone is rotated in landscape 
mode counterclockwise (this is the only way it can be mounted in the osmo 2 
without obstructing the microphone on the right). I'm currently recording 
audio with a different app running in the background and record video only 
with Filmic. It's a lot of extra work synching audio, it would be great if 
this issue could be fixed. -120 fps 1080p videos with the playback rate set 
to 24 fps are dropping frames like crazy but the recordings are fine if the 
playback rate is left at 120 fps and the video is slowed down in post or by 
just remuxing the mp4 file and forcing the framerate to 24. -No HDR support 
for the LG V30. Please add it if possible.
replyContent: Hi Daniel, active tracking is not supported for 3rd party apps right now. As soon as the DJI SDK supports this, we will work on it. About the other issues, we will look into it (if you find anything else, please contact us via androidsupport@filmicpro.com). Thank you for your detailed review and have a nice day!

content:
(help?) So far the app looks awesome. I'm really impressed with the results 
and the control. A major flaw with the Huawei P20 Pro is that you cannot

version of this app first and it said that stabilisation does work with my

basic feature of my phone. Is there a way to fix this? If so I'll gladly 
give you 5 stars!!!
replyContent: Hi Sean, we support Optical IS, but the stock app uses EIS and it isn't supported for 3rd party apps :(. Regarding locking the ISO or shutter, it should be available just tapping on one of them (turning to red). If you have more questions, please contact us via androidsupport@filmicpro.com. Thank you for your review and have a nice day!

content:
Filmic pro is a great application for filmmakers without professional gear. 
My one gripe (and it may just be on my end) is that the video files do not 
properly save to my note 8's camera roll. I can view them with ease in app

ongoing issue or a mistake on my part?
replyContent: Hi Cole, N8 doesn't support standard 4K for the Camera2 API (the one we need to support as many features as we do), so we have to use the next one higher than that. Sadly, the native gallery app isn't capable of playback those clips :( Thank you for your review and have a nice day!

content:
Update: Just recently, I got feedback from the developers. My response: I 
cannot believe that they would choose to have smooth zoom over image 
quality. Most filmmakers don't even use zoom during recording. Even then, 
with the camera zoomed in, the image becomes immediately unusable because 
the image is all pixelated. The only way to ever get good close-ups is with 
a telephoto lens on the camera. Why implement digital zoom when the 
digitally zoomed image is going to be bad to begin with?
replyContent: Hi Gordon, we cannot use the same approach as OC because most devices wouldn't have smooth zoom transitions ;) ;) Thank you for your review and have a nice day!

content: Pros: + Feature full, especially after the latest update + Beautiful and  functional UI + Great customer support, they respond quickly and give you a  lot of info regarding your issue + Can record 4K compared to similar apps  which are limited to 3K on my LG G6 Cons: - Performance is bad on my  device, especially when there is a lot of iso noise or movement to the  scene, even at lower resolutions. I thought that that's to be expected  since there is processing to the image before creating the MP4 file, but  I've found that apps like Cinema 4K offer recording at a flat 3K profile  without any performance issue. That might be due to the lower preview  resolution that the app might use. I'll be better with a smaller preview  and fluid performance than having to be worried that my final video will be  chopy. Keep up the good job guys and I if performance issues are addressed  I'll be more than happy to rate you higher.
replyContent: Hi, we're continuously working to improve performance while bringing new features. Please stay tuned! Thank you for your review and have a nice day!

content:
This is an amazing camera app with one massive flaw. Video file sizes cap 
out at 4.08gb, if you go over this size it cuts the video into separate 
clips. However footage always goes missing in the process, meaning you 
can't film anything longer than 10 minutes (in 4k high bitrate, can record 
longer at 1080p standard bitrate). There are free camera apps that get 
round this by disabling the max file size limit (since found others use 
phone default size to get round this). Really hope the development team see 
this and fixs this problem, then I'll rate 5 star and this will hands down 
be the best camera app on both iOS and Android. I'm more than happy to bug 
test for you. üòâ Edit: the team have got back to me really quickly and have 
been incredibly helpful, if you have any hesitations with buying this app I 
can tell you it's well worth the price for it's features. Although my 
problem isn't fixed I have every confidence that the developer will update 
this in future (if possible üòâ).
replyContent: Hi George, I've seen that you've already contacted us via androidsupport@filmicpro.com. Yours is the only device that support such feature for third party apps (as far as we know). Anyway, we'll consider your request ;) ;) ;) Also, the clips should overlap a bit, so no footage should be missing... Thank you for your review and have a nice day!

content: Hi.  How do I go about getting a refund?  I'm using filmic pro on a Google Pixel and I'm getting quite a lot of difference in the recorded frame rates. I'm choosing 25FPS and each take varies quite a bit in its frame rate. One take even went down to 13.16FPS, others are fractional rates around the 22 to 24 mark, despite choosing 25FPS. I'd been shooting outside with a lot of light as well, so it's not the shutter being dropped to gain light and then the frame rate being matched to the shutter for low light exposure.  Even if I try the experimental force frame rate function I get the same results. These frame rates obviously can't be cut together in a 25FPS project without interpolation and/or frame blending, which isn't acceptable. It would also make the footage impossible to cut with another synchronised camera.  The same also happens with 30FPS, although I've not tried that rate as much as I wouldn't usually use it, I only tried it to see if I could get any timebase with a solid frame rate.  Before buying the app I'd ran the free Filmic app to make sure that my Pixel was compatible. Everything registered fine and there was no warning that the full app wouldn't perform as expected
replyContent: Hi David, could you contact us via androidsupport@filmicpro.com attaching a sample clip and the configuration used (resolution, bitrate, etc)? Also, try again with airplane mode enabled, because third party apps affect performance when recording video. Thank you for your review and have a nice day!

content: Practically perfect... Except for one thing. As a vlogger, I need to be able to capture switching back and forth from cameras. I use the Osmo Mobile. You can even call it "vlogging mode".

Never would've thought that, after paying a rather high price for an app, I would need to pay another amount to have the Filmic Log options. The only reason for getting the Filmic app were the Filmic Log. Other than that, it is almost identical (did I say almost?) with Cinema FV5. Why did I purchase the (essentially) same app? For the Log. Now I see that, for getting access to that panel of options, I need to pay. And it's not a 1.99 price, not by far...  Extremely dissapointed with this business practice. Not gonna recommend it to anyone using Android.  I would like to get a refund because it is very unclear that you need to pay. I did not see anywhere such a "warning"...
replyContent: Hi Romeu, the majority of our customers do not have the need for the high-end gamma curves and color/tone controls and that is why they are in an optional purchase (as the app's description says).  These controls are similar to those on cameras costing thousands... Also, watch the tutorials in order to reach the app's full potential ;) Thank you!

content: This app has great features and I'm sure it works perfectly on an iPhone 7s, however on my Samsung Note8 and DJI Osmo Mobile, I'm having some odd and frustrating problems in regard to usability. Filmic does not save settings on exit. Every single time I start the app, I have to set up device specific options all over again, set the color profile, connect the Osmo, etc. I'm not sure if this is an Android general problem with Filmic. Another problem with he Osmo seems to be that it the joystick always moves the gimbal no matter what mode is selected. This means of you use the joystick to pull focus, the phone will also tilt up or down at the same time. Any thoughts? I sure hope these can beade better, the Note8 is one of Androids biggest flagships with killer cameras to.boot.
replyContent: Hi Matt, could you contact us via androidsupport@filmicpro.com? 350 characters aren't enough ;) Thank you for your review and have a nice day!

content: Filmic must acknowledge the many flaws on Samsung s8 please. Its criminal to sell to people when Filmic know, and have documented to me the flaws.  Disgusting company with no ethics. Rubbish...This is a beta version. So many issues it's not worth using. eg -  Judders if you use 48khs. So why have the option?. Nor can it be 4k...why have the option? Voice sync issues on every level.  Export to another device and sound alters levels. Switch to 24mb and sound level drops to low.  So  This app is a beta that should not be released.  We run a videography buss. This has cost us money...loss.of time interviewing.  We are back to the original Samsung camera - it works. Filmic where are your ethics?

I will rate 5 stars once you fix the variable (should be constant) 24 FPS @ 4K on LG G5. Apart from that the features and flexibility this app has are outstanding. I have already sent you an email from your technical support web page describing in further detail the bug I discovered.  Update 1  I am going to buy LG V30 soon, which is one of the best (if not the best) smartphone for videography out there at the moment. It shoots 24FPS and it's got lots of manual settings out of the box. I really hope that the developers of this app sort out the framerate problems which seems to be a common problem among the most popular android phones.
replyContent: Hello Stylianos,  Thank you for writing in.  All smartphones and tablets (even iOS) record video at inherently variable frame rate.  There is no ability for constant frame rate on any device at this point.  that said our latest framework offers the most consistent frame rates that have been offered on Android to date and we will keep at it! Thanks!

content: Great app really nice layout and features. although it still feels very much like a work in progress, I came across some issues but support were very helpful and put me on the beta version to see if things were fixed.

The video frame rate issues continue to plauge the  Samsung Note 8 fans using this application. Once they get that addressed you will have a winning product again. Until then if you have a S8 or N8 don't buy!!
replyContent: Thank YOU for the amazing review Jason.  Any questions .. you can reach us at androidsupport@filmicpro.com

content: Has incredible potential. Unfortunately does not yet support shooting over 3gb files so rather useless for longer shots, which is my use case. They really need to have a limitations page in which they list known issues, cause video support on Android is a minefield of issues currently. Really, if you want to shoot reliable video at the moment, buy a iPhone or a dedicated device. Hopefully Android will evolve in this area, but when it does this app will be the best, but for now a combination of app bugs and hardware snafus means stay away.
replyContent: Hi Lloyd, Thank you for the review.  We also appreciated the conversation we had in our support queue.  The team is close to providing continuous shooting (via multiple files).  Your insights were technically correct on a lot of levels but not possible for implementation on the majority of Android devices.  We will respond back to you shortly. thx!

'Tripod mode' for timelapse has not been exposed by DJI so cannot be supported in any app but their app.  Please contact our support team for more details:  androidsupport@filmicpro.com

Bought this to use on a shoot where I had to pay for commercial access. Complete failure. This app does not record 4k smoothly. Footage is jumpy as it looks like frames are being skipped or there is lag in the file writing. 8 hours and 500.00 plus the cost of this app and add-ons wasted. No useable footage. This app should be pulled. Samsung Galaxy 7 edge.
replyContent: Thank you for the review A.D. apologies for what you saw there.  We checked out support queue and do not see any report similar or from a name like yours.  Would you be able to write us a note with the details and any sample footage you can share?  androidsupport@filmicpro.com

content: Autofocus doesn't work on my s8. It only works when I unlock the focus. But only once for a half second then it won't work. Please fix....  no AF sucks.
Won't Auto focus or manual focus on my Note 8... Pretty pointless if I can't get clear video...
Hey ,ive just bought this app ... its really cool ... but how to make a smooth slowmotion ?.... im using galaxy note8

Very impressed! I bought Filmic Pro for my Note 8. So far the footage that I've gotten I've actually been pretty impressed with and I find useable on a paying job. Disclaimer: I am a professional video...type...person, so I'm shooting manual and know a bit about settings this emulates. The program itself is solid and works well once you set up. There are a few little bugs, but I've been talking to support about them (who are awesome) and they've been very helpful in bug reporting\etc. The only downside for Note 8 users is that they do not yet have support to use the telephoto lens on the phone. Samsung is not releasing that to third parties until 2018, from what I've been told.
replyContent: Thx for the review Timothy.. you are an educated pro who is 'in the know' ... you are correct about the Note 8 lens support.  Samsung rushed the Note8 out to market without any ability for an app developer to access the lenses.  Drop us a line any time with questions or suggestions:  androidsupport@filmicpro.com

content: I enjoy the app much better than than the stock camera. This gives me way more control and opens up small features that are great when shooting shorts; great output. I hope it continues to fix and improve on itself as it is a great app. A couple of issues, one the controls to change the zoom speed and ISO speed are too far out and sometimes are difficult to get a hold of. Two, which is the big one, the auto focus does not work. I really wish it did. I can definitely work around it, but not having that makes some situations more complex than need be. Pixel XL (first gen, 2016)
replyContent: Hi Andrew,  Thank you for the review.  by Autofocus we assume you mean 'continuous' autofocus so that the reticle will keep sampling even if you do not move it.  This is actually not possible as it is not supported in the Android spec (although it is on iOS).  for more details:  androidsupport@filmicpro.com

content: Can you please add support for Zhiyun gimbal.

Updated review after emailing the filmic guys. Framerate issues on note 8. Am told it is a known problem with note and s8 line. Apparently they are speaking to Samsung to hopefully get a fix sorted. Until then I'd recommend people with galaxy phones hold off buying this app if you want smooth video. If the framerate drops and stuttering can be fixed this would be a very impressive app worth the price.
replyContent: Thx for the review Ed..  yes indeed.. the team has a full agenda planned for the app.  Much new functionality coming.  Samsung conference next week and hope to return back to the lab with some good news on some of the device specific limitations for the S8 line.  Thanks.

content: S7 Edge user. I bought FilmicPro + the Cinematographer add-on and went shoting some test footage. The quality of the image (shot in 4k 100mbs) is lower than that captured using other apps. I tried all modes (Natural, Dynamic, Flat, Log) and every option gets you the same poor quality image. Not saying that this is not camera dependent but the image I get from another app (Lumio Cam) is inifinitely smoother and cleaner than what FilmicPro gets out of the same camera. Wish there was a way to get my money back but by this time there's no option for it. Do yourself a favor and spare an expesive test of this app. Guys @FilmicPro you should really consider offering a trial version of the app, valid even for one day, before making customers pay blindly for something they may not need.
Love the app. Used on S7 edge fore mic gain.  Can't locate mic gain menu on Note 8?
replyContent: Hi Peter, the audio gain control is under the medallion, where the audio meter is.

content: I just payed 20$ for this app and now I have to pay another 10$ for some kit? The whole point of me getting this app was because I thought everything was included. What is this?
Was not able to connect my osmo, Support team responded and has been very helpful, update rating accordingly.
replyContent: Thank you Pratik,  as you know our support team is on the case.  We have discovered that DJI quietly sent an update to the OSMO firmware which may be causing the issue.  We have pulled a newer version of their SDK and hope to have this resolved quickly.  Thank you for the report it was a huge help.

content: I will give this app more star's but problem i have Samsung galaxy s8+ even basic phone camera allows 60frame at 1080p but this app don't show any frame option over 30frame i am disappointed i paid over $15 for what? Sad
replyContent: Hello MK.. this is Unfortunately Samsung's implementation of the camera framework does not allow us to offer 60fps right now. This is reserved for their own native camera app through a private API we do not have access to.  You can verify this in any other camera app you may have as well.  Only the Google Pixel is exposing this feature correctly.

content: I am using this app on the oneplus 3t and every time I shoot and no matter the frame rate I set. The picture and audio always loose sync or I drop a frame which leads to reshooting small interviews I am conducting. Incredibly disappointing
replyContent: Hi Padraig... we would like to hear from you in our support channel on this one.  We are not tracking any sync issues in the app.  Please contact us here:  androidsupport@filmicpro.com

content: Still not support full HD 60fps on samsung note 8. Pls upadate it.
replyContent: Hello Tony .. This is actually a Samsung limitation.  Most manufacturers are in the same situation.  They have not exposed the 60fps value through their api's for use by a third party camera app.  We encourage our customers to write to their handset manufacturers and ask for this to be included in an update.  Samsung will get to this eventually.

content: Love this app. I was a beta tester. A few things need working on and I'll update my review. Autofocus does not work on my pixel or pixel 2. White balance jumps around like crazy and you cannot set it to stay in one place if your recording multiple clips. Even if you lock white balance for one clip it resets after that clip is done. Stabilization does not stay on and you should be able to turn it on and leave it on every time. This app is worth the money. Once the bugs are fixed it'll be great.
replyContent: Hello John.. thank you for your assistance on the beta team.  We had a great time working with everyone.  A truly professional platform on Android is a daunting task but we are up for it  üëç    We are working on the white balance and stabilization issues and you'll see them come into play in an update soon.  questions:  androidsupport@filmicpro.com

content: Love the interface but can't seem to find a way to access second lens on a dual camera setup. ASUS ZenFone 3. This is a must. Am I missing something or is this feature yet to be introduced to the android version?
replyContent: Hi Kenton,  Thank you for the review.  The issue for dual lens cameras on Android is that support is a device by device implementation.  There is no single way to manage dual lens cameras.  It is infinitely more difficult to support dual lens devices than on iOS right now.  Drop us a line to discuss further:  androidsupport@filmicpro.com

content: It really is a good app but I am a little confused as to why I cannot record in 1080p 60fps or 720p 240fps on my Samsung Galaxy S7 Exynos which is already capable of said resolution and framerates? The main reason I bought this app was to remove the OIS and oversharpening and compression of the default camera app but I am limited to 1080p 30fps and 720p 120fps...
replyContent: Hi Jordan.  Thank you for the review.  The limitation here is actually Samsung's.  They have no implemented those frame rates for you by any other app other than the native camera app.  We have discussed this with Samsung and they are planning to release support for this eventually.  Contact us at androidsupport@filmicpro.com for more details

content: Expansive set of features makes this the definitive video recording app for advanced video projects, especially with the latest update. I have to reiterate again though that the UI/UX is holding this app back from its full potential. Please reference LG and Samsung's Manual mode, as well as Cinema4K for UI that offers plenty of control without aesthetic or interactive detractions. Issues include: small touch points or too close to the edge interfering with Android's software navigation buttons, obtuse radial dials to make adjustments.

content: Why does the app not allow me to record 1080p at 60fps or higher on the s8? I've just spent ¬£20 On this app and feel like I have been cheated
replyContent: Thank you for the review George.  60fps is not a standard frame rate supported through the Android API.  Hardware manufacturer support for this frame rate is limited in a private API and for use by the native camera only.  We hope this will change at some point in the future.  Contact us if you have any questions:  androidsupport@filmicpro.com

content: Autofocus not working on Pixel phone, can't recommend... It's been going on for months and still no resolution. I did open a support ticket and problem was acknowledged months ago, with no fix provided.

Its ok...BUT...a few issues, and MASSIVELY annoying bugs, which make a bunch of the app features unusable. Basically only using it so I can plug in an external mic. 1- It doesn't keep your last settings used as the default when you open the app again. Simple fix, annoying to keep changing it. 2 - focus pulling doesn't work on my Asus Zenfone 3 ZE552KL. Focus works fine, just not when trying to focus pull. 3 - It doesn't fix variable frame rates to constant frame rate. 4 - Selfie (front camera) mode is mirrored,which is super confusing. My native phone app has a button to swap this - why doesn't FiLMiC?  5- Shutter icon to select exposure area does nothing on my phone either. Works fine when selecting ISO manually using left hand bar. Basically the opposite of the focus issue above.  6 - Timelapse simply doesn't function. 7 - Files are buried deep in the Android file structure which makes them annoying to deal with and find, particularly wirelessly.  8- It says alternative frame rates for your device are possible, but they just aren't. No SloMo, no Timelapse. Just good old variable 30fps.  PLEASE fix these FiLMiC Pro - This is a great app, and Android really needs it too!
replyContent: Hi Creative State, could you copy&paste this and send it to androidsupport@filmicpro.com? 350 characters aren't enough ':D Thank you for your extended review and have a nice day!

content: I have a google pixel xl and a dji osmo mobile and i have 3 issues with the app 1. Crashes when i want to play my movies in the library especially in landscape mode 2 It doesn't find the osmo mobile to pair ( i did change the name in bluetooth back like it was...so it's not regarding that...it finds it but won't let me connect so is kind of useless from this point of view ) 3 The focus is really annoying...even if i center it and fix it,let's say on an object ( or don't do it at all ) when i switch scenes like going from a room to another it's not focusing properly and ruins all the movie ) The only thing that i do apreciate is the difference in quality and steadyness in comparison with the dji go app...and that it let's you film at 24fps. replyContent: Hi Alin,  Thanks for the review. Not seeing a support ticket from you with these concerns. Write to us:  androidsupport@filmicpro.com.  The OSMO issue is easily resolvable: Try 'un-pairing' your OSMO from the bluetooth control in the settings menu of your device? content: Thus far, the app seems good and well structured. However, on my Google Pixel, it is buggy. Stabilization doesn't seem to work, I'll get dropped frames here and there, and I'll have to restart occasionally as manual controls such as ISO and shutter speed stop working for no discernible reason. My biggest problem is not having the option to manually control exposure/exp. compensation, even though the evaluator app AND the app description on here said it was capable on my device. That doesn't make me the happiest customer.
replyContent:
Hi Bruno.  Thank you for the review and also for pointing out the confusion in the app description.  We have made changes.  

Stabilization is unfortunate with the Google Pixels...they do support stabilization but only while using the camera1 (older) Android camera API.  FiLMiC Pro requires the camera2 api for our manual capabilities.

content: Hi. I have purchased this app for my LG G4, Android V.6.  I really Liked it after watching tons of youtube tutorials for it on the God Damn lucky IOS Iphones !! After prolonged playing with the app, I have found all these bugs. 1- Flash: After Tab Holding, No Flash Slider to select from 4 light Intensity as IOS.  2- Exposure:  After Tab Holding, No dial for Exposure Compensation (3rd manual circle) as IOS.  3- Frame Rate is Faulty with 4K:  choosing 24 fps ------  the result is 22.9 fps  choosing 25 fps------ the result is 20.2 fps  choosing 30 fps------ the result is 21 fps  4- No > 30 fps for any resolution, i.e No Slow Motion Recording !!  5- No Stitch Recorded Footage; i.e. No Pause of recording.  So Please fix it in the next update as I intend to use it on my other Galaxy s7, Android V.7.  Thanks. P.S. I've Already reported these bugs to your email before you ask to drop a line.

content: It's a very nice app which I was looking for! Perfect for recording fully manual Videos! But there is one thing, I can't record on Full HD with 60 fps even though my galaxy s6 has the capability in the "normal Photo app" of Samsung. WHY? Would be the perfect App!
replyContent: Yes this is a pain right now.  Only the Google Pixel has exposed the high speed frame rate capability according to the Android spec.  We are working on our own high speed frame rate to get by the imposed manufacturers limitations.

content: On my S7 I can't use the app in portrait mode even orientation lock is set to off. Front facing camera gives me an inverted image.  Please let me know what's wrong with your app.

content: I used this app years ago on iOS and thought the Android version would be worth buying despite the price tag. It is not. We notice two stars in this review, so please do drop us a note at androidsupport@filmicpro.com if you have questions/concerns.

content: Update: I just spoke with someone from Filmic regarding these issues. Although I still think calling them sync frame rates is misleading (because they are still variable) I am improving my review from 1 to 3 stars because of the customer service. Obviously, in general phone developers' camera software still has a long way to go before they will even be as reliable as DSLRs. First Review: If you wanted sync frame rates on your GS6 look elsewhere.  This app will not do them. This app is worse than the stock android app. Frame rates are farther off from goal, the default picture profile is to contrasty and has a severe green tint. No histograms. No 720@120fps despite  native support of it. Complete waste of 10$, maybe it's good on iPhone, but definitely not android.
replyContent: Hi Rob, could you contact us via androidsupport@filmicpro.com? We need more than 350 characters in order to answer all of your concerns :) The latest update have fixed some issues and added new features (histograms included). Thank you for your review and have a nice day!

Love it.

Amazing app. Unfortunately doesn't work for my lg g4

content: A proper professional filmmaking app for Android! As a filmmaker I loved this app on iOS, when I jumped ship there was nothing but one other app. Since you guys are working solely with the provided camera API 2, we're not able to access some of the more device specific camera functions of our devices (S7 Edge for instance) 4K PAR is off for some reason and no access to OIS, dual pixel focus or 60/120/240fps. That being said, AMAZING APP!!! Would like to see a Samsung camera driver implementation.

Really like the app since I can play around the DOF now. Only thing is, I'm waiting for the 60fps, so I can start shooting smooth slow motion footage. Please update it as soon as possible..(Samsung Note 5 user)

As others have suggested (including the app creators), this app does not function properly on the LG G4. Though a big fan of the app, which was my go-to app on the iPhone, it does not appear to be able to hold on to the manual settings applied when used on the G4, resulting in ISO/exposure time values skipping when recording. For the time being the only app that allows full video recording manual controls on the G4 is the LG v10 camera apk from xda forum (no root needed), which is basically the v10's stock camera app ported for the G4 and functions flawlessly (albeit without any of the advanced functions Filmic Pro offers). I would suggest the the app creators took a look at it too and by all means warn G4 users about these issues in the description here.

Works very well on my Iphone 6plus. 60p! Wow more like my professional video camera. (Switching to IOGRAPHY!) Audio works very well too for simple 1 channel. My next project is using connector with 2 mic and 1 monitoring jack. Hope the apps can adjust independent level that will be the ultimate update.  On my Samsung GS7 Edge Not that good. Recording limit to 10mins for 60p. Focus, iris,shutter are not locking on subject. Need more updates please!  Congratulations for having a Great Apps Developer.You Rock!

I installed this app on my iphone 6 no issues.  Two problems i have when I installed it on my Samsung Galaxy S6.  The counter for length of time filming is missing a zeros.  It only has 5 zeros so it doesn't look like I am filming until it gets to 10 seconds.  The other issue is after I use the focus square to pull focus it disappears so I have to exit the app and then open it again to make it reappear.  I have emailed tech support but nobody has got back to me from Filmic Pro..... UPDATE...! Thanks to Kevin for sorting everything. 1.  My font size was set too large on my phone and as a result it hid one of my zeros. 2.   I needed to long press the focus reticule to make the focus square return. Done and sorted.  Thank you Filmicpro
replyContent: Hi Cathy, Thank you for contacting us. We're looking at the problem now, we'll email you back soon!

content: Only allows for 30 fps max.  Stock app will do 60 fps. The stock app will do most of the things this app will do, for the exception of the audio controls.  Nice app, but needs more work to become better than the stock Note 5 app.  Uninstalled, refund requested.
replyContent: Hi Tim, We're currently working to support more than 30fps, please wait for future updates!

content: Love it. This is perfect, all I have been looking for. Works like a dream. One complaint is the app closes when I click 'back' on my phone. Perhaps, 'press twice to leave' instead? Also 60fps would be good because I know my phone supports it. (S6 edge plus)
replyContent: Thanks Jake for your review! The double press to leave the app will be added in the next update this weekend. We're currently working to support 60fps, please wait for future updates!

content: Can't seem to work using 1080p 60fps. Even at 720p.... it only supports 30fps.
replyContent: Hi Kenneth, We're currently working to support more than 30fps, please wait for future updates!

content: Was a little hard for me to figure out at first but they helped me and I'm excited for the possibilities of this app

Ok we all know something this technical will have a few bugs. I experienced one not long ago. I emailed the team and now there's an update for it. Outstanding customer services to match an outstanding app. I've had this on my iPhone for a few years now and can't fault it and up to now I'm having the same experience on my Samsung. Thanks guys. Keep the updates coming!

I use this app on my Nexus 6P and it is great. It has all the manual controls that I look for and the app itself is pretty easy to learn. The major downfall this app has is the poor reliability. Quite often after recording for 3 or 4 minutes the app just freezes and even though it says it is still recording it actually isn't recording anything! I don't hate the app but the reliability issue makes it hard to love it.

People need to appreciate that this app isn't your quick, snap happy video app that quick publishes to Facebook or something. This is a fully featured, extensive, detailed app for some serious videography. It's so impressive what these devs are achieving, and it's unsurprising given the mammoth nature of the task that there are minor niggles or glitches every now and then on some devices. I, for one, am grateful that they're bringing top quality shooting - long a brag factor of iOS - to Android devices.

The bar is set pretty high with all of the features of this app. Favorite little feature is the ability to pull focus at whatever speed you prefer. And the team has been good about pushing updates to fix and optimize.

Would say to those who find it's not up to scratch, ask for a refund and try the plus version. Give the development team a break as they've got the unenviable task of recreating the ios success across many more devices. I've been getting excellent results on my LG G5.
replyContent: Thx Martin - appreciate the review...and you have hit the nail on the head in terms of our commitment to democratizing new media on Android in the same way we did on iOS.  All the best and drop a line to androidsupport@filmicpro.com if you have any questions.

content: Device frequently hangs during recording on a Nexus 6P (this is a Nexus so if you can't get it stable you might as well give up on Android altogether.) Especially on time lapses where it completely ruined several scenes, it appears to be still recording but in fact has stopped. The interface is kiddish. You mean to tell me this app is used by pro filmmakers and it's worth $14? Come on. Even a refund wouldn't assuage my anger.
replyContent: Hi Luke,  We apologize for your anger over this.  The specific issue you mentioned related to time lapses should be resolved for the 6P with the latest update (which went live the day after your review).  Can you please give a look at the update and let us know your findings.  You can write us at any point at androidsupport@filmicpro.com

Hi Tony,

content: Samsung Galaxy S6 - purchased the app as it had great blog reviews however for my Samsung it just didn't work as it should. Bugs and stability issues. content: Excellent app for full, professional control with mobile filmmaking. Thanks for bringing this app to Android!

It didn't work at first but I messaged the company and addressed the problem. After getting a timely email back and waiting for a week like they said until they received my model phone, it finally works. I'll be diving more in depth soon but the way you handle the issues is impressive. Don't lose that customer service. Thanks, Kendall.

Please consult Google's design guidelines for what an application should look like. I'm not paying $10 for an app that looks like it's from 2011. If you want to make the big money on the play store you need to do better.

I can honestly say this has been one of the more useful apps on the playstore that I've used to date. Still some minor tweaks to be done, but beyond the potential behind this app, the customer service is what earned it the 5 stars. How personable the responses are, how timely the get back to your concern, etc! Top notch!!!
replyContent: Hi Bryan, This app doesn't pretend to be an exact copy of the IOS version. The hardware and OS have their limitations in both sides and it's impossible to have the same functionality. Even different Android phones may differ in functionality for the same reason: the hardware is different. There isn't much we can do about it, unfortunately.

content: This is one of the best camera apps I've found for Android

Should have waited with Android release.  There are just too many issues for this app to be considered stable and too many features missing "while we are working on them." There's also a problem with excessive contrast that can't be adjusted. Sure, you can underexpose and hope to restore detail in darker areas in post production. But for a "state-of-the-arts" app, that's unacceptable. I recognise that creating a sophisticated app that works equally well on many Android phones is a much taller order than it is for the few iPhone variants. But that's precisely why they should have waited or at least waited to charge for an unfinished product. Bad sport!!

I started having problem with the app having corrupted video most of the time. Contacted the support team,  which is very great! I also had a problem with the focus and exposure receptacle, and told them my problem. They acknowledged the problem and addressed it within a few days! Now i took like 10 vids in succession and it now worked perfectly. This is 5 stars for me,  just because of the support they are giving in the android version. These guys are serious!
replyContent: Hi Fritz, could you contact us via androidsupport@filmicpro.com? Thus we could find out the issue and fix it. Thank you for your review and have a nice day :)

content: The Android version of this app still needs a lot of love. I'm using it on my Samsung S7 and there are several features that either don't work or are broken in some fashion or another. A few cases in point, I cannot control the mic audio gain at all. The slider moves up and down properly, but doesn't affect the audio feed whatsoever. Another is the focus lock. I can move the slider which will temporarily move the camera focus to that point, but then the camera immediately attempts to auto focus on something else within the frame. Even without the use of the slider, setting the app to lock the focus does nothing. The camera focus on whatever it feels is the main subject. Exposure is also somewhat broken. While I can manually set exposure and it does stay locked, moving the exposure reticle to different parts of the view does absolutely nothing. It's always using a weighted balance over the entire image. So, i have to full frame a section that has the correct exposure, then lock that level, and finally pull back to the scene I want to capture. There are more problems, but I'm out of words for one review.  If they can mirror the iPhone app (which I also have) 5 stars. For now only 3.
replyContent: Hi Craig, thanks for your extensive review. We just got a Samsung S7 so we'll work on fixing these problems. Please contact us at androidsupport@filmicpro.com if you have more questions.

content: Hi. Bought this app last night. Great app, but im having a bit of a problem about the fps. Why is is that whenever i record i dont get exactly 24 fps, i get somewhere between 22-23 fps. How do i have a fix fps. My device is samsung galaxy s6
replyContent: Hi Justin, The app, and Android itself, cannot guarantee an exact frame rate, this one depends of a lot of factors like the exposure and it fluctuates. This is a limitation of the operating system I'm afraid.

Bought this thinking I would be able to adjust my FPS. Can not. Want a refund.

content: Paid for this app and only the start screen shows. How do I get a refund? Not worth the money i paid or the time it took to install. (S6 EDGE)

content: Enjoyed this update. You adressed the shutter speed issue on Note 5. And focus reticle is improved on Note 5

I'm sure this app is great for iPhones, but it doesn't seem to work well on Android devices. Moving the focus reticle does not lock onto the intended object and it becomes blurred. Moving the auto exposure reticle does not work at all. I had big hopes for this app, but it is a big disappointment. I wish I could get a refund but my 2 hours are up. Don't make the same mistake I made. They should offer a free "lite" version so users can test compatibility with their devices.
replyContent: Hi William, we're sorry to hear that. There're features that are device dependent, and we're hard working to get the best experience on all of them. About the refund, please contact androidsupport@filmicpro.com. Anyway, thank you for your review, we hope that you can enjoy the FiLMiC Pro experience in the near future. Have a nice day :)

content: Choppy video at 1080 30fps and no frame rate higher than 30fps in all resolutions

Although this is a very powerful video recording app, it is implemented in a way that is illogical for Android users.  One example is the "remove" button in the clips browser. Why couldn't you just use the word "delete"? The developers should remember that these are not Apple users using FilMic on Android, these are Android users who may never have seen your Apple app! Another example is scrolling through the menus. It is completely illogical for an Android user. With all that said it is a very powerful video recording app. My favorite feature is the ability to set the file names by project, and have them incrementaly updated as I create new takes. So from an engineering perspective it's a magnificent app, but please hang the Apple GUI designer from a tree, and get someone more used to developing GUI on Android!
Just lost very important one of a time footage. Ended up with 2.5Gb unplayable file. Nexus 6, 4k UHD @ 100Mbps.
replyContent: We're deeply sorry :( Thank you for letting us know about this issue, we'll keep the hard working in order to fix this as soon as possible.

It's records the  video but on play back all it plays is the sound...thank you for your time...
replyContent: Thank you for trying our app, Aldo. Please install our last update, published today, and let us know if you continue having issues.

content: Awesome app used it on the Galaxy S6 and it is well worth the cost, I been waiting for years for Filmic pro to be on the Galaxy line . Extremely pleased with the results.
Just got it today and it works very well on my Galaxy Note 5!!

Use this daily for work as a local video journalist and features on it are great. Especially love the ability to pull focus and zoom and generally all the sliders are really useful.  Only reasons I can't give it a 5 is because there are too many glitches on my Samsung S6. These are...  -Regular crashes when using the front-facing camera. Often freezes up when adjusting exposure using this camera. -Audio monitoring goes mental when you unplug headphones while it's switched on. I.e. loads of horrible feedback -Occasional failure of audio at beginning of video recording.  -Not a glitch,  but inability to have higher frame rate than 30p. -Inability to save audio gain setting, which would be useful for when using different equipment. -the app forgets every single setting as soon as you quit the app or the phone goes to sleep.  Hoping these will be solved in the next update! But overall, best app out there for video.
replyContent:
Thanks for your review Ben!
We're working on these problems right now. A note for the Galaxy S6 users: the FPS drop down while adjusting the exposure is an S6 problem, I'm afraid we can't do much to solve it... We're also trying to support more than 30fps but Samsung doesn't facilitate this option for 3rd party developers.

content: I purchased the app just to support and encourage future updates. Would love to see these three key features for film makers: 1) Add flip image support for DOF adapters. 2) Include high bit rate of 200 mbps(like cinema 4k). 3) Create a flat profile (again like cinema 4k). 4) De-squeze moondog anamorphic lens. Hope these make it in future updates, great work guys!
replyContent:
Thanks for your review Chris!
We will support DOF and moondog lens very soon! About the 200mbps, we don't recommend using more than 100mbps, the results aren't that great and you can experiment a drop in the performance. Maybe we could increase it up to 130mbps, we'll think about it!

content: The native camcorder is way better,  and gives you almost as much control. The end result looks much better without using FiLMiC.

LG V10 user here. i heard that the two reticles are the core of this app... but for my phone..seems its not working.i was moving the focus and/or exposure reticles.but no changes happens on the fly.. but if i steady the (example)  exposure reticle and move the phone..then it changes(sometimes)..maybe its a bug?

Works very well on my Nexus 6P, pleasantly surprised. A few minor issues/suggestions: The controls are slightly cut off when viewing/editing a video. Icon-only primary UI isn't very intuitive; perhaps small text labels would be immensely helpful for newcomers. It would be great to see an Android-specific user manual that takes into account possible missing hardware features - maybe even a free 'compatibility' app that queries the camera API and explains available features or known limitations of the user's device.
Phone stays thinking when I touch video then force close. Nexus6 5.1 lollipop

I want to start off by saying I love this app because I've seen what it is capable of on the ios platform. With that said I've encountered some issues while playing around with it on my Galaxy Note 5. After recording a clip only the audio will playback in the Filmic library and in the phone's gallery. I also had an issue while trying to use headphone monitoring while using an external microphone. Another thing is that would be nice is to have an image flip option for using DSLR lens adapters.

In 1080p it works great but when I cranked it up to 4k i came across some glitches. It would jump cut every 3 seconds or so and the audio would be off sync. I have a galaxy s6 and have shot in UHD before with no issues but when going true 4k problem came up. Hope the next update can fix this.
replyContent: Thanks Felix for your report. This problem happens often on S6 and Note 5 using 4K. We're working on a solution!

content: I would have given this app a 4 if there was a 35mm flip. I am also getting problems when recording in 4k where the camera display would shut off after 3 seconds of recording. It may be because of the camera over heating
replyContent:
Hi Roville,  At the time the final requirements for the Android version of the app there were no suitable adapters for 35mm flip nor the Moondog lens. That has obviously changed in the last few months. We will be adding support for both of these in the near future.  

Can you write in to androidsupport@filmicpro.com regarding the 4k display issue?

content: So far I have been very pleased with this app. Comparing videos shot using this app, the defult camera app (on my Galaxy S6) and videos shot on the IgCamera app, I generally prefer this app. I do hope that in future updates the app will support higher bit rates than 50Mbps for my 4k video.
Video not playing after recording. Just audio. Using a Samsung S6 Edge Plus
replyContent: Thank you for letting us know Carlos. We're actively working on a solution, it will be fixed on the next update!
